1.description: A brown MudWing dragonet raised in captivity with four others under a mountain. Kind-hearted and hungry, believed to be one of the dragonets of destiny from the prophecy.

15.description: Discovered to have fireproof scales, a rare MudWing ability that makes him immune to fire attacks. This saves him in the SkyWing arena.

1.description: A fierce blue SeaWing dragonet with a short temper and strong protective instincts. Brave and loyal to her friends, often acts as their leader.

26.description: Revealed to be the daughter of Queen Coral of the SeaWings, making her a true princess. Her royal heritage explains her natural leadership abilities.

1.description: A sarcastic RainWing dragonet with color-changing scales that reflect her moods. Often feels like an outsider since she wasn't part of the original prophecy.

6.description: Revealed to be a replacement for the original SkyWing dragonet who died. Her venom is deadly and can be shot from her fangs with deadly accuracy.

relationships.Hvitur: Dragon who died protecting her egg

1.description: A nervous black NightWing dragonet who loves scrolls and learning. Anxious and cautious, but deeply knowledgeable about dragon history and lore.

23.description: Discovers he doesn't have the traditional NightWing powers of prophecy or mind-reading, making him feel inadequate among his tribe.

1.description: A small, optimistic yellow SandWing dragonet who always sees the good in others. The smallest of the group but has the biggest heart.

25.description: Noticed to be smaller than normal SandWings and missing the typical venomous tail barb, suggesting unusual parentage.

1.description: A harsh, orange-red SkyWing dragon who serves as one of the dragonets' guardians. Strict and often cruel in her training methods, believing toughness is necessary for their destiny.

25.description: Revealed to have her own tragic past, having lost her own dragonets to Queen Scarlet's cruelty, which explains her harsh demeanor.

1.description: A pale yellow SandWing dragon who serves as a guardian to the dragonets. More patient than Kestrel but still stern about their training and destiny.

24.description: Dies from his infected wounds sustained during the dragonets' escape, showing his dedication to their cause even unto death.

1.description: A green SeaWing dragon who serves as the kindest of the three guardians. Often tries to mediate between Kestrel and the dragonets.

relationships.Tsunami: Student he stole as an egg

26.description: Revealed to have stolen Tsunami's egg from the SeaWing palace, making him a traitor to his own tribe but believing it necessary for the prophecy.

relationships.Riptide: Nephew in the Talons of Peace

2.description: A brown MudWing who was supposed to be Clay's guardian but died before the dragonets hatched. Mentioned as being gentler than the current guardians.

relationships.Clay: Was meant to be his guardian

6.description: A white IceWing who died protecting Glory's egg when she was still in the shell. His death led to Glory becoming the replacement for the original SkyWing dragonet.

9.description: The cruel red SkyWing queen who rules through fear and spectacle. Obsessed with her gladiator arena where dragons fight to the death for her entertainment.

15.description: Forces captured dragons to fight in her arena for sport. Takes particular interest in Clay when he proves fireproof and survives multiple matches.

relationships.Glory: Dragon she plans to execute slowly

14.description: A fierce orange SkyWing with firescales - her touch burns anything, making her deadly in combat. Queen Scarlet's undefeated arena champion.

25.description: Revealed to be Kestrel's daughter, thought to have died as a dragonet. Her firescales condition made her too dangerous to raise normally.

10.description: Queen Scarlet's son and heir to the SkyWing throne. Arrogant and cruel like his mother, enjoys watching the arena matches.
A high-ranking SkyWing general who serves Queen Scarlet loyally. Helps oversee the arena and palace security.

14.description: A SkyWing prisoner forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. One of many dragons captured and used for the queen's entertainment.

8.description: A large, imposing black NightWing who claims to have created the dragonet prophecy. Mysterious and intimidating, with hidden motives for the prophecy.

23.description: Tests the dragonets harshly and shows disappointment in their progress, particularly criticizing Starflight for lacking traditional NightWing powers.

5.description: One of three SandWing sisters fighting for the throne after Queen Oasis's death. The largest and most militaristic, known for her collection of rare creatures and artifacts.

24.description: Kills Dune with her venomous tail barb when he tries to protect the dragonets from capture, showing her ruthless nature.

26.description: Clay's older brother and the bigwings of his sibling group. A capable brown MudWing who has been caring for their siblings since Clay disappeared.
One of Clay's sisters from his MudWing family. Lives in the marshland with Reed and their other siblings.
One of Clay's sisters, a young MudWing who was just a dragonet when Clay was taken. Now grown and living with the family.
One of Clay's younger brothers, a brown MudWing who grew up hearing stories about his missing brother Clay.
The youngest of Clay's siblings, a small MudWing who was born after Clay was taken by the guardians.

15.description: A MudWing prisoner forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. Dies in combat while the dragonets watch helplessly.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Captor who forced him to fight
relationships.Clay: Fellow MudWing who witnessed his death

14.description: A blue SeaWing prisoner in Queen Scarlet's arena, forced to fight for the queen's entertainment. Has been there so long he's nearly broken.

15.description: A MudWing gladiator in Queen Scarlet's arena. Fights against Clay in one of the arena matches.

10.description: A SkyWing guard who serves in Queen Scarlet's palace. Helps maintain order and security in the Sky Palace.

14.description: A white IceWing prisoner held in Queen Scarlet's dungeons. Scheduled to fight in the arena but tries to maintain his dignity despite captivity.
A purple-and-pink RainWing held prisoner by Queen Scarlet. Drugged with sleeping darts to keep her docile and unable to use her venom.

9.description: A large brown MudWing soldier who serves in Queen Scarlet's army. Helps capture the dragonets when they're brought to the Sky Palace.
A reddish SkyWing soldier who patrols Queen Scarlet's territory. Part of the group that captures the escaped dragonets.

5.description: One of three SandWing sisters fighting for the throne. Known for her beauty but considered the least intelligent and capable of the three sisters.
One of three SandWing sisters fighting for the throne. The most cunning and manipulative of the sisters, allied with Queen Coral of the SeaWings.

25.description: A mysterious NightWing animus dragon living as a hermit in the desert. Has been slowly turning to stone due to his use of animus magic.

relationships.Sunny: Dragon whose parentage he hints about

25.description: A SandWing member of the Talons of Peace who helps the dragonets after Dune's death. Missing one claw from an old battle wound.

26.description: A SeaWing leader in the Talons of Peace organization. Coordinates efforts to end the war between the dragon tribes.
A young blue SeaWing member of the Talons of Peace. Nephew to Webs and eager to help end the war between tribes.

5.description: The former SandWing queen and mother of Burn, Blister, and Blaze. Her death sparked the current war of succession among her daughters.

24.description: A SandWing soldier serving under Burn's command. Participates in the attack on the Talons of Peace stronghold.

25.description: A tough SandWing who leads a group of outlaw dragons in the desert. Skeptical of the dragonets but willing to help them.

relationships.Six-Claws: Ally who asks for her aid

25.description: A SandWing prince, son of the late Queen Oasis and brother to the three feuding sisters. Chooses to stay out of the succession war.

15.description: A SandWing prisoner forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. Dies in one of the brutal matches while the dragonets watch.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Captor who forces him to fight

10.description: A SkyWing guard who serves in Queen Scarlet's palace. Helps maintain security and watches over prisoners.

9.description: A SkyWing soldier who participates in capturing the escaped dragonets. Serves Queen Scarlet with unwavering loyalty.
A SkyWing patrol dragon who helps track down the escaped dragonets. Known for his sharp eyesight and flying skills.

10.description: A swift SkyWing who serves as a messenger for Queen Scarlet, carrying orders throughout the Sky Kingdom.

12.description: A SkyWing who helps manage Queen Scarlet's arena, overseeing prisoner movements and fight preparations.

10.description: A noble SkyWing who attends Queen Scarlet's court. Part of the audience that watches the arena matches.

11.description: A SkyWing who works in Queen Scarlet's palace kitchens, preparing meals for the queen and her court.
A small SkyWing servant who works in Queen Scarlet's palace, cleaning and maintaining the royal quarters.

12.description: A SkyWing who tends to the dragonets in Queen Scarlet's wingery, caring for young SkyWings until they're old enough to serve.

15.description: A powerful SkyWing forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. One of the few prisoners who has survived multiple matches.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Queen who forces him to fight

14.description: An IceWing prisoner held in Queen Scarlet's dungeons. Maintains her dignity despite the harsh conditions of captivity.
An elderly IceWing prisoner who has been in Queen Scarlet's dungeons for years. Weak from long captivity but still proud.
A brown MudWing captured and imprisoned by Queen Scarlet. Scheduled to fight in the arena against other prisoners.

9.description: A MudWing soldier serving under Queen Scarlet's alliance. Helps capture the escaped dragonets.

15.description: A MudWing forced to participate in Queen Scarlet's arena fights. Dies during one of the brutal matches.

relationships.Clay: Fellow MudWing who watches his death

14.description: A green-and-blue RainWing held prisoner by Queen Scarlet. Drugged with sleeping darts to prevent her from using her venom.
A RainWing prisoner who constantly shifts colors due to fear and stress. Kept docile with sleeping darts by Queen Scarlet's guards.

relationships.Glory: Fellow RainWing who gives him hope

14.description: A young RainWing prisoner held in Queen Scarlet's dungeons. Too drugged and weak to properly use her natural color-changing or venom abilities.
A blue-green SeaWing prisoner forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. Struggles without access to water for extended periods.

15.description: A SeaWing warrior captured and forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. Dies in one of the matches while desperately trying to survive.

14.description: A large SeaWing prisoner held in Queen Scarlet's dungeons. One of the longest-surviving prisoners due to his size and fighting ability.

8.description: A black NightWing who accompanies Morrowseer and serves as his assistant. Observes the dragonets' progress with cold calculation.

23.description: A NightWing spy working with Morrowseer to monitor the dragonets' progress. Reports back on their activities and compliance with the prophecy.

24.description: A fast SandWing scout serving under Burn's command. Helps track the dragonets for the attack on the Talons of Peace stronghold.
A SandWing soldier serving under Burn who participates in the attack on the Talons stronghold. Named after the desert terrain.
A fierce SandWing warrior in Burn's army. Participates in the brutal attack that kills Dune and destroys the Talons' stronghold.
A SandWing guard in Burn's forces who helps surround and attack the Talons of Peace stronghold where Dune dies.

25.description: A SandWing outlaw who lives in the desert and is part of Thorn's group. Helps provide shelter to the dragonets after Dune's death.
A tough SandWing outlaw living in the desert with Thorn's group. Experienced at surviving in the harsh desert conditions.
A young SandWing outlaw who is part of Thorn's desert group. Quick-witted and good at finding water and shelter.
A small, alert SandWing outlaw who serves as a lookout for Thorn's group. Expert at spotting danger from long distances.
A SandWing member of the Talons of Peace known for her speed. Helps coordinate between different Talons groups across Pyrrhia.

26.description: A SeaWing member of the Talons of Peace who works with Nautilus to coordinate peace efforts across the sea kingdom.
A SeaWing warrior who joined the Talons of Peace to end the war. Works under Nautilus to establish peace between the tribes.
A young SeaWing who admires the dragonets of destiny and wants to join their cause for peace.
Clay's mother, a brown MudWing who grieved when her bigwings dragonet was taken. Overjoyed to see Clay return home safely.

27.description: Clay's aunt, a MudWing who helped raise his siblings after he was taken. Welcomes him back to the family with warmth.

relationships.Clay: Nephew she helped raise siblings for

27.description: Clay's cousin, a young MudWing who grew up hearing stories about the missing bigwings. Excited to finally meet the legendary Clay.

10.description: A large red SkyWing who commands the palace guard forces. Responsible for security around Queen Scarlet's throne room and treasures.

12.description: A SkyWing guard who oversees prisoner movements to and from Queen Scarlet's arena. Enjoys watching the violent matches.

9.description: A fierce orange SkyWing soldier who participates in capturing the escaped dragonets. Named for his fiery temperament.

11.description: A brown-red SkyWing who maintains weapons and armor for Queen Scarlet's forces. Works in the palace armory.

12.description: A young SkyWing dragonet in Queen Scarlet's wingery. Too young to serve but watches the older dragons with eager eyes.

relationships.Jay: Wingery keeper who tends to her

10.description: A small gray SkyWing who serves as Queen Scarlet's personal spy. Gathers intelligence on potential threats to the throne.

14.description: A loud SkyWing who announces the arena matches for Queen Scarlet's entertainment. Enjoys whipping up the crowd's bloodthirsty enthusiasm.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Queen whose arena he announces for

11.description: A cruel SkyWing who oversees Queen Scarlet's dungeons and tortures prisoners. Takes pleasure in others' suffering.

19.description: One of Queen Scarlet's most skilled SkyWing warriors. Leads the pursuit when the dragonets escape from the Sky Palace.

9.description: A large SkyWing who specializes in flying during storms and bad weather. Helps track the escaped dragonets across difficult terrain.
A swift SkyWing patrol dragon known for her circular flight patterns. Helps search for escaped prisoners from above.

11.description: A SkyWing guard who works the night shift in Queen Scarlet's palace. Keeps watch over prisoners during the dark hours.

14.description: A noble SkyWing who regularly attends Queen Scarlet's arena matches. Enjoys betting on which prisoner will die first.

11.description: A small, dark SkyWing who cleans the chimneys and fireplaces in Queen Scarlet's palace. Often covered in ash from her work.
A powerful SkyWing who operates the palace forge. Creates weapons and tools for Queen Scarlet's army and household.

10.description: A grim SkyWing who oversees executions and 'special' punishments for Queen Scarlet. Designs creative methods of death for entertainment.

relationships.Glory: Dragon whose slow death he plans

11.description: A SkyWing who tends to all the fires throughout Queen Scarlet's palace. Ensures torches stay lit and fireplaces burn properly.

relationships.Magma: Forge master she supplies with fuel

12.description: A large SkyWing responsible for maintaining the palace's heating systems. Keeps the royal chambers at the perfect temperature.

11.description: A gray SkyWing who cleans up after arena matches and disposes of waste throughout the palace. Unpleasant but necessary work.

9.description: A massive SkyWing who patrols the mountain peaks around Queen Scarlet's territory. Expert at navigating treacherous mountain terrain.

14.description: A small brown MudWing captured during a skirmish and forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. Tries to stay hopeful despite captivity.

relationships.Clay: Fellow MudWing who gives him hope

15.description: A tough MudWing warrior captured in battle and forced to fight in the arena. Dies bravely while trying to protect weaker prisoners.

relationships.Cattail-fighter: Fellow MudWing who dies with him
relationships.Clay: Fellow MudWing who mourns his death

15.description: A young MudWing prisoner who was barely old enough to fight when captured. Terrified of the arena but tries to be brave.

relationships.Clay: Older MudWing he looks up to

14.description: An old MudWing warrior who has survived longer than most in Queen Scarlet's arena. Teaches younger prisoners how to fight and survive.

relationships.Clay: Fellow MudWing he tries to guide

9.description: A brown MudWing soldier serving with Queen Scarlet's allied forces. Helps in the capture of the escaped dragonets.
A MudWing tracker who excels at following trails through muddy and swampy terrain. Helps hunt down escaped prisoners.

15.description: A large MudWing bigwings captured with his sibling group and forced to watch them die in the arena. Dies trying to protect his family.

relationships.Clay: Fellow bigwings who understands his pain

26.description: A blue SeaWing guard who serves in Queen Coral's palace. Part of the royal security force that protects the SeaWing royal family.
A fast-swimming SeaWing who scouts the ocean territories around the Sea Palace. Reports on threats and movements near the kingdom.
A SeaWing messenger who carries communications between different parts of Queen Coral's underwater kingdom. Expert at deep-water navigation.
A SeaWing architect who designs and builds underwater structures for the royal palace. Skilled at working with coral and sea materials.
A green SeaWing who tends the underwater gardens around Queen Coral's palace. Grows kelp forests and tends sea anemones for food and beauty.
A young SeaWing who serves in Queen Coral's palace, cleaning chambers and serving meals to the royal family and guests.
An elderly SeaWing who teaches young dragonets in the Sea Palace. Specializes in SeaWing history and underwater navigation skills.

relationships.Queen Coral: Queen whose children she once taught
relationships.Tsunami: Princess she wishes she could have taught

26.description: A SeaWing military captain who leads patrols of the ocean borders. Commands a squad of SeaWing warriors defending the kingdom.
A dark blue SeaWing who explores the deepest parts of the ocean. Brings back rare treasures and information from the ocean depths.
A noble SeaWing who serves in Queen Coral's court. Part of the royal council that advises the queen on matters of state.

24.description: A SandWing guard serving under Burn's command during the attack on the Talons stronghold. Fights fiercely for his queen.
A SandWing scout known for her ability to blend into the desert landscape. Uses stealth and camouflage to track enemies.
A SandWing healer who treats wounded soldiers in Burn's army. Named after the life-giving oases of the desert.
An experienced SandWing warrior who has fought in many battles for Burn. Leads younger soldiers in the attack on the Talons stronghold.

relationships.Burn: Queen he has served for years

24.description: A deadly SandWing assassin who specializes in silent kills with her venomous barb. Part of Burn's elite strike force.

25.description: A dangerous SandWing outlaw who joined Thorn's group for protection. Known for her quick striking attacks with her tail barb.
A SandWing outlaw excellent at tracking through sand dunes. Can follow trails that others miss and move silently across sand.

relationships.Thorn: Leader who relies on his tracking

25.description: A small but fierce SandWing outlaw known for her excellent hearing. Can detect approaching enemies from great distances.
A SandWing outlaw who specializes in hunting scavengers for food and materials. Knows how to track the small creatures across the desert.
An old SandWing outlaw who has wandered the desert for decades. Knows secret water sources and safe hiding places.

23.description: A powerful black NightWing warrior who accompanies Morrowseer. Intimidates the dragonets with his size and silent menace.

8.description: A NightWing scout who helps Morrowseer monitor the dragonets' activities. Skilled at moving unseen and gathering intelligence.

23.description: A menacing NightWing enforcer who ensures other dragons comply with Morrowseer's demands. Uses fear and intimidation as weapons.

8.description: A sharp-minded NightWing guard who serves as part of Morrowseer's security detail. Cold and calculating in his duties.
A swift NightWing messenger who carries communications between different NightWing operatives. Fast and reliable in her duties.

14.description: A proud IceWing captain captured during a battle and imprisoned in Queen Scarlet's dungeons. Maintains military discipline even in captivity.
A fierce IceWing warrior captured in the same battle as Tempest. Remains defiant even while imprisoned by Queen Scarlet.
A young IceWing scout captured while on a reconnaissance mission. Struggles with the heat of Queen Scarlet's palace.

relationships.Tempest: Captain who tries to protect him

14.description: A noble IceWing captured when her patrol was ambushed. Maintains her aristocratic bearing even in Queen Scarlet's filthy dungeons.

15.description: A massive IceWing warrior forced to fight in Queen Scarlet's arena. His size makes him dangerous but also a larger target for opponents.

relationships.Clay: MudWing he respects for his fighting skill
relationships.Tempest: Captain whose orders he still follows

14.description: An elderly RainWing prisoner captured while sleeping in the forest. Too drugged to properly use her color-changing or venom abilities.

relationships.Glory: Young RainWing who gives her hope

14.description: A creative RainWing who was an artist before her capture. Even drugged, she tries to make beautiful color patterns on her scales.

relationships.Chameleon: Fellow RainWing who admires her colors

14.description: A RainWing healer captured while gathering medicinal plants in the rainforest. Tries to help other prisoners despite being drugged herself.

relationships.Mango: Young RainWing she tries to protect

14.description: A wise RainWing who taught dragonets before her capture. Even drugged and imprisoned, she tries to educate the younger prisoners.
A simple RainWing who gathered fruit in the rainforest before being captured. Confused and frightened by her imprisonment.

relationships.Hibiscus: Healer who tries to calm her

3.description: A small scavenger creature encountered by the dragonets during their early explorations. Tiny and terrified of the large dragons.

relationships.Sunny: Dragon who shows kindness to small creatures

7.description: A slightly braver scavenger encountered during the dragonets' escape attempt. Shows more curiosity than fear.

25.description: The leader of a small group of scavengers encountered in the desert. Tries to protect its pack from larger predators.

11.description: A trained bird used by Queen Scarlet to carry messages between distant parts of her kingdom. Quick and reliable.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Queen who uses it for communication
relationships.Kite: Dragon messenger it sometimes works with

14.description: A large black crow that frequents Queen Scarlet's arena, feeding on the remains of fallen fighters. Symbol of death and defeat.

relationships.Queen Scarlet: Queen whose arena provides it food

11.description: A crafty rat that lives in Queen Scarlet's dungeons, surviving on scraps and staying hidden from the larger predators.

relationships.Glory: Prisoner whose cell it sometimes visits
relationships.Scorch: Dungeon keeper who tries to catch it

26.description: An ancient sea turtle that lives near Queen Coral's palace. Considered wise by the SeaWings and occasionally consulted for advice.

25.description: A venomous snake encountered in the desert by the outlaw dragons. Small but dangerous to those who underestimate it.

1.description: A hardy mountain goat living near the dragonets' underground prison. Occasionally seen by the dragonets during their limited outdoor time.

relationships.Clay: Dragon who spots it during explorations

recaps.1: Clay, a brown MudWing dragonet, lives underground with four other dragonets of destiny who are prophesied to end the great dragon war. Their guardians Kestrel, Dune, and Webs train them harshly for their future role.
recaps.2: The dragonets learn more about the prophecy that foretells their destiny to choose the next SandWing queen and end the twenty-year war. Clay struggles with whether he truly has the greatness the prophecy demands.
recaps.3: Tensions rise between the dragonets and their guardians as the young dragons question their captivity. Glory, the RainWing, feels particularly excluded since she wasn't part of the original prophecy.
recaps.4: The dragonets attempt to explore beyond their underground prison but are caught by their guardians. They learn more about the three SandWing queens fighting for the throne: Burn, Blister, and Blaze.
recaps.5: Starflight shares his extensive knowledge about the dragon tribes and their history with his friends. The dragonets debate which SandWing sister would make the best queen to end the war.
recaps.6: Glory's backstory is revealed - she's a replacement for the original SkyWing dragonet whose guardian Hvitur died protecting her egg. The dragonets realize their guardians have been lying to them about many things.
recaps.7: The dragonets plan a daring escape from their underground prison. They're tired of waiting for their guardians to release them and want to fulfill the prophecy on their own terms.
recaps.8: Morrowseer, a mysterious and intimidating NightWing, arrives to check on the dragonets' progress. His visit spurs the dragonets to finally attempt their escape from the mountain stronghold.
recaps.9: The dragonets successfully escape their underground prison but are quickly captured by SkyWing soldiers. They're taken as prisoners to Queen Scarlet's palace in the Sky Kingdom.
recaps.10: The dragonets meet Queen Scarlet, the cruel SkyWing queen who delights in violence and spectacle. She decides to use them as entertainment in her gladiator arena rather than execute them immediately.
recaps.11: Imprisoned in Queen Scarlet's dungeons, the dragonets meet other prisoners including dragons from various tribes. They learn about the queen's obsession with her deadly arena fights.
recaps.12: The dragonets are separated and prepared for different fates. Clay is chosen to fight in the arena while his friends face various forms of execution as entertainment for the queen.
recaps.13: Clay is forced into the arena to fight for Queen Scarlet's amusement. He must battle other dragons while his friends watch helplessly from their prison cells.
recaps.14: Clay meets Peril, Queen Scarlet's undefeated arena champion whose firescales make her touch deadly. Despite her dangerous nature, she shows curiosity about Clay and his friends.
recaps.15: Clay discovers he has fireproof scales when Peril's deadly touch doesn't harm him. This rare MudWing ability saves his life in the arena and amazes both Peril and Queen Scarlet.
recaps.16: The arena battles continue as Clay is forced to fight multiple opponents. His fireproof scales give him an advantage, but he struggles with having to harm other dragons to survive.
recaps.17: Clay's friendship with Peril grows as she begins to question Queen Scarlet's methods. Meanwhile, his friends work desperately to find a way to escape their various death sentences.
recaps.18: The dragonets devise an escape plan involving Glory's deadly venom and Tsunami's leadership skills. They must coordinate their efforts while avoiding Queen Scarlet's surveillance.
recaps.19: Chaos erupts in the Sky Palace as the dragonets execute their escape plan. Glory uses her venom to deadly effect while Tsunami leads the breakout from their prison cells.
recaps.20: The dragonets fight their way out of the Sky Palace with help from some sympathetic prisoners. Peril must choose between her loyalty to Queen Scarlet and her new friendship with Clay.
recaps.21: Peril aids the dragonets' escape by using her firescales to clear their path. The group flees the Sky Kingdom with Queen Scarlet's forces in hot pursuit behind them.
recaps.22: Free from Queen Scarlet's prison, the dragonets head toward the Kingdom of the Sea to return Tsunami to her family. They hope to find allies among the SeaWings for their mission.
recaps.23: Morrowseer catches up with the dragonets and harshly judges their progress. He's particularly critical of Starflight for lacking the traditional NightWing powers of prophecy and mind-reading.
recaps.24: The dragonets face an attack by Burn's forces at a Talons of Peace stronghold. Their beloved guardian Dune is killed by Burn herself, leaving the dragonets heartbroken and more determined than ever.
recaps.25: The group seeks shelter and allies among the Outclaw dragons led by Thorn. They meet mysterious figures including Stonemover, an animus dragon slowly turning to stone.
recaps.26: The dragonets reach the Kingdom of the Sea where Tsunami is reunited with her mother Queen Coral. They learn about Tsunami's royal heritage and the SeaWing royal family's troubles.
recaps.27: Clay reunites with his MudWing family and learns about his siblings who grew up without him. The dragonets prepare for the next phase of their quest to fulfill the prophecy and end the war.
